greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Alternating sums of the squares of the ordered Bell numbers (number of preferential arrangements) A000670.
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..200
formula: a(n) = sum((-1)^(n-k)*t(k)^2, k=0..n), where t = A000670 (ordered Bell numbers).
mathematica: t[n_] := Sum[StirlingS2[n, k]k!, {k, 0, n}]; Table[Sum[(-1)^(n-k)t[k]^2, {k, 0, n}], {n, 0, 100}]
program: (PARI) for(n=0,30, print1(sum(k=0,n, (-1)^(n-k)*(sum(j=0,k, j!*stirling(k,j,2)))^2), ", ")) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Feb 07 2018
results.author: _Emanuele Munarini_, Oct 02 2012
